Package ClientSideTests

Class TestHashPassword

java.lang.Object
ClientSideTests.TestHashPassword
public class TestHashPassword
extends java.lang.Object
The following tests are used to test the functionality of the HashPassword class.
Author:
Johnny Madigan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TestHashPassword()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void createSalts()
    Before each test create a new unique yet random SALT string in-case any test modifies one.
    void testHashing()
    Test if the password parameter inputs are within the bounds...
    void testHashLength()
    Although random, SHA-512 algorithms always produce keys 128 characters long
    void testInvalidPassword()
    Tests if the IllegalString exception is thrown whenever the password is invalid.
    void testSaltContents()
    Tests if the SALT generator creates SALTs that are alphanumeric only
    void testSaltHasUsername()
    Test if the SALT generator concatenates any username to the end

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • TestHashPassword

      public TestHashPassword()

  • Method Details

    • createSalts

      @BeforeEach @DisplayName("Before each test create mock SALT strings") public void createSalts()
      Before each test create a new unique yet random SALT string in-case any test modifies one.

    • testSaltHasUsername

      @Test @DisplayName("Tests if the SALT generator concatenates any username to the end") public void testSaltHasUsername()
      Test if the SALT generator concatenates any username to the end

    • testSaltContents

      @Test @DisplayName("Tests if salt strings are alphanumeric") public void testSaltContents()
      Tests if the SALT generator creates SALTs that are alphanumeric only

    • testHashing

      @Test @DisplayName("Tests if password bounds, if all passwords can be hashed, the test will pass") public void testHashing() throws IllegalString
      Test if the password parameter inputs are within the bounds... if no exception is thrown then the test passes
      Throws:
      IllegalString - if the password is invalid

    • testHashLength

      @Test @DisplayName("Tests if password was hashed correctly via it\'s length (128 characters)") public void testHashLength() throws IllegalString
      Although random, SHA-512 algorithms always produce keys 128 characters long
      Throws:
      IllegalString - if the password is invalid

    • testInvalidPassword

      @Test @DisplayName("Tests if the given password does not meet the requirements") public void testInvalidPassword() throws IllegalString
      Tests if the IllegalString exception is thrown whenever the password is invalid. Invalid passwords are those with white-spaces.
      Throws:
      IllegalString - if the password is invalid
